WorkItem.Description:
How about adding another filter for items using the itemlevel?   For instance, in working Ulduar, you can comfortably set your minimum item level to at least 200, if not 213.  Then as your minimum gear level goes up, you can push this up to 219, 226, or beyond.  
 
Also, you might consider filtering by item stats.  For instance, as a PVE Arcane Mage, I never want items that have MP5 _or_ Resilence on cloth.  (The MP5 is a no brainer, and the days of farming AV for High Warlord gear to PVE in are long gone).
 
I think you are already doing some form of weighted filtering on items, because I sometimes see items with wierd negative scores(?).  Perhaps this item selection weighting could be exposed as a dialog?   I could then apply a large negative value to resilence, MP5 -- like I think melee stats already have.

Comments.Message: P.S.> I know you can theoretically turn off resilence items by disabling "PVP" items, but since some of these items come from emblems, they still appear to be slipping through.

There is no weighing of items. Negative scores come from situations where equipping something actually drops value to less than having an empty slot.

Filters already support item level conditions.
Here is an example.  It's not at all clear why "Figure - Twilight Serpent" or "Figurine - Sapphire Owl" would have a negative DPS implications.

They probably have a jewelcrafting gem in them which would put you above 3. When you get above 3 the implementation is to disable the value of all gems so you're losing the value of jewelcrafting gems on 3 of your equipped items when you try to equip the figurine.
